U.S. GRAND LODGE(ORDO TEMPLI ORIENTIS USA)BALANCE SHEETAs of February 28, 2002AssetsReceivable from OTO International44,056.81NOTOCON Fund4,203.17Grand Lodge Building Fund2,750.00Quartermaster Account2,152.97USGL Main Checking Account2,053.86Office Equipment3,500.006US Grand Lodge Archives3,000.006Temple Furnishings & Regalia2,500.006Xth Degree Jewel2,091.007Undeposited Funds515.00GSG Expense Account200.09Total Assets$67,022.90Liabilities & EquityGMG Expense Account2,188.04Opening Balance Equity93,245.09Retained Earnings(300.00)Net Income(28,110.23)Total Liabilities & Equity $67,022.90NOTES 1.Includes dues collected by OTO International and dues collected by US Grand Lodge onbehalf of OTO International. Does not include local body dues. 2.All members pay dues to OTO International. OTO International provides a concession of50% of dues paid by US-based members to US Grand Lodge for national administration. 3.Includes only fees for Grand Lodge initiations â€“ does not include local body initiation fees. 4.Includes attorney's fees for USGL corporate counsel on retainer, and legal fees associatedwith defense of lawsuits brought against OTO within the United States. 5.This loss is absorbed by a reduction in the amount owed to USGL by OTO International. 6.Estimated Value. 7.Appraised Value.Statements prepared April 22, 2002 by Vere Chappell,Grand Treasurer General, Ordo Templi Orientis USA
